pullRequest.body:
Lint against being `$` used in place of the canonical `<|`: this is documented in the mathlib style guide.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [0ec886bc69](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15909/commits/0ec886bc69ff3cc06e6e38a38e84e8ecbfe53403)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ dollarSyntaxLinter`
`+ findDollarSyntax`
`+ instance (f g : Nat â†’ Nat) : Inhabited Nat`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

Thanks for writing this linter; it is always great to see the style guide automatically enforced. Can you extract the replacements into their own PR? Then they can land independently and need not wait until the linter is reviewed.
The linter looks pretty straightforward. Looking at the style guide, I wonder whether always recommending <| and never `|>` is correct. Can you comment on this?

> I wonder whether always recommending <| and never `|>` is correct

`|>` is a different operator.

> > I wonder whether always recommending <| and never `|>` is correct
> 
> `|>` is a different operator.

You are perfectly right; thanks for teaching me this difference!
ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by grunweg.
Just as heads-up: you will need to cherry-pick `1fafd71ff90bd9899e24336fc149823f74981aae`; feel free to do so.
(A new file with six dollar symbols was merged in the mean-time.)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10449243067/job/28931162465)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10449243067/job/28931162802)

Thanks!
maintainer merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

I took a very careful review at the linter and only found four very small comments.

Once the fixes have landed and you have addressed them, this is good to go. (Let me know if you prefer help with the last comment.)

Thanks!
maintainer merge

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

I like to think carefully about linter wording: what do you think about the following change?
```suggestion
      Linter.logLint linter.dollarSyntax s m!"Please use '<|' instead of '$' for the pipe operator."

How about adding a sentence of justification, here and to the `register option`?
"These are disallowed by the mathlib style guide, as using `<|` pairs better with `|>`."
Note to self: when #15616 lands, make sure to also tweak this default. (At the moment, it's not clear which PR will land first.)

Thanks for including a test! Can you extend it slightly, to
- include more than one dollar (writing "f $ g $ 0" suffices perfectly here)
- also include other kinds of syntax nodes? (Some ideas: include a theorem, definition or lemma; include this syntax inside a have, let or nested goal, and nested inside a more complex term proof. Ping me if this is unclear!)
I've done this now.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: the dollarSyntax linter
